question.questionA: Upper segment of fruit globose or ovoid, shortly beaked.
question.questionB: Upper segment of fruit cylindrical or oblong-ovoid.

question.questionA: Leaves fleshy, glabrous; upper segment of fruit not more than three times as long as wide, mitre-shaped, usually one-seeded.
question.questionB: Leaves not fleshy, hispid; upper segment of fruit at least five times as long as wide, cylindrical and often constricted between the seeds.
